works.complaint:
Defamation is a statement that gives a negative  
impression of a person, company, group, product, government, or country.  
The statement is made as though it were true, when in fact, it is false.  
Defamation can be slander, which is made with spoken words, sounds, sign  
language, or gestures. Defamation in any other form, like in printed words
 
or pictures, is libel. To be considered defamation, the claim has to be  
false, it has to be made as if it were true, and it has to have been  
communicated to people other than the entity being defamed.
